body.p: Any security log data collected must comply with these metadata standards to ensure we are able to consistently interpret log data using other systems.

li.p: a: all log events must be time stamped in the common log timestamping format as defined by ISO8601 [dd/MM/yyyy:hh:mm:ss +-hhmm] where the fields are defined as follows:
1: dd is the day of the month
b: systems must use an automated time syncing protocol (such as NTP) with an external time source to ensure it is not subject to 'time drift' that may impact the accuracy of time stamping.

body.p: Only the following log file formats should be used:

li.p: b: NCSA (Common or Access, Combined, and Separate or 3-Log)
d: W3C Extended Log File Format
e: W3C Extended (used by Microsoft IIS 4.0 and 5.0)
g: IBM Tivoli Access Manager WebSEAL
